qas.question: Who won the first Nobel Prize in Physics?
In what year, was the first Nobel Prize in Physics won?
Where is the Walhalla temple located?
What two people were important to the creation of modern physics?
What did Werner Heisenberg lay the foundation for?
What prize was first given in the 19th century?
Who got a Nobel Prize in Physics in the 19th century for discovering the X-ray?

context: The work of <a4_0>David Hilbert and Max Planck<a4_0/> was crucial to the foundation of <b5_0>modern physics<b5_0/>, which Werner Heisenberg and <b6_0>Erwin Schrödinger<b6_0/> developed further. They were preceded by such key physicists as Hermann von Helmholtz, Joseph von Fraunhofer, and Gabriel Daniel Fahrenheit, among others. <a0_0><a1_0><b8_0>Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen<b8_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/> discovered X-rays, an accomplishment that made him the first winner of the <b7_0>Nobel Prize in Physics<b7_0/> in <a2_0>1901<a2_0/>. The Walhalla temple for "laudable and distinguished Germans", features a number of scientists, and is located east of Regensburg, in <a3_0>Bavaria<a3_0/>.
